Key Match Events: Walker mishandled a transfer to his throwing hand as he wheeled toward second and was charged with an error
Luis Frias uncorked a two-out, two-strike wild pitch that scored Josh Jung
Corey Seager’s third two-run homer of the World Series
Texas scored five runs in the third inning, punctuated by Semien’s three-run homer that put them up 10-0
Post-Match Reflections: Arizona now trails Texas 3-1 going into Game 5 on Wednesday night
Manager Torey Lovullo said, 'This was nothing that we saw coming'
Walker said, 'I’ll be accountable, I should have made the play, should have at least got one'
Semien said, 'Those are propellers into big innings, like the next one'
Miscellaneous Highlights: Gold Glove first baseman Christian Walker ended a record run of perfect fielding at the World Series
Texas is the first team in World Series history to score at least five runs in consecutive innings
The Rangers also became the first team to score at least five runs with two outs in consecutive innings since Milwaukee accomplished the feat against Montreal in a 1999 regular-season game
